meeting_annotations.screenshare_content: Barbara shared a document titled "2022 MND Discussion Group Assignments.pdf". The document's topic is "Model Organisms". The document contains questions about the use of animal models in research and how well they replicate human biology.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Barbara Bendlin
meeting_annotations.transcript: So, our prompt, you know, just for a few moments of reflection is, many studies can be done on animal models that cannot be done on humans. How well do these studies replicate human biology? What caveats are needed? What can be done to better humanize the models to make the data more valuable or actionable? And you know, just given that that uh so many people in this room are working on organisms, I think it would be on model organisms, it would be good to also consider how, you know, which which ones are working and what are we happy with and what are the um what are the benefits of these different models. So I'll give everybody a few moments to just reflect on this and write down your initial thoughts.
